Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the amount of debt accumulated under President Obama by stating that it is more than all previous presidents combined.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or data to support the assertion that the debt under President Obama surpasses the combined debt of all previous presidents.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that all the debt accumulated under President Obama should be attributed solely to him, disregarding the fiscal legacy inherited from his predecessor.
Understate: The claim understates the amount of debt accumulated by previous presidents by comparing it to a smaller timeframe (two years) under President Obama.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation for the debt accumulation, which includes the fiscal legacy inherited by President Obama and the economic circumstances during his presidency.
